admiralty.name: Admiralty
admiralty.description: The Admiralty allows exotic resources to be imported into the coastal village

armoury.name: Armory
armoury.description: The Armoury is required for training armored units within the town

axeSmith.name: Axe Smith
axeSmith.description: The Axe Smith is required for training units armed with axes

bakery.name: Bakery
bakery.description: The Bakery increases the ability of the town to support its citizens with pastries. It increases both food storage and food supply

ballistaTowers.name: Ballista Tower
ballistaTowers.description: The Ballista Towers are equipped with ballistae. During sieges and assaults, they automatically fire missiles towards the enemy

beeYard.name: Beeyard
beeYard.description: The Bee Yard features bee-hives, which produce honey and beeswax

bulwark.name: Bulwark
bulwark.description: The Bulwark is a massive stone wall designed to protect the town. It increases the amount of time needed for the enemy to take the town by siege. It also reduces the attrition amongst the defenders

butcher.name: Butcher
butcher.description: The Butcher supplies the citizens with fresh meat. This ensures that the towns will endure longer when under siege

catapults.name: Catapults
catapults.description: The Catapults are placed on the drum towers. They increase the attrition that the enemy armies suffer during sieges. The catapults on the towers are very deadly and shoot automatically during assaults

cathedral.name: Cathedral
cathedral.description: The Cathedral raises more piety in your province than a simple church. Orthodox Christians need a cathedral to be able to claim independence from the church

cattleFarm.name: Cattle Farm
cattleFarm.description: The Cattle Farm supplies cattle, which can be used to strengthen the economy of the town

cauldrons.name: Cauldrons
cauldrons.description: The Cauldrons are placed on top of the gates. During assaults, they cause deadly damage to enemies who try to breach the gates

chainMailWorkshop.name: Chain Mail
chainMailWorkshop.description: The Chain Mail Workshop is required for training chainmail-wearing units within the town

church.name: Church
church.description: The Church increases and raises piety in the provinces. It also raises the price for religious conversions in this province

coastGuard.name: Coast Guard
coastGuard.description: The Coast Guard watches for enemy ships in the nearby coastal waters. If the enemy attempts to land on this realm's coastline, the Coast Guards will rise to prevent the landing

cornerTowers.name: Corner Tower
cornerTowers.description: The Corner Towers strengthen the town's fortifications. They increase the attrition suffered by the besieging enemy. They also provide outstanding tactical positions for the defending archers during assaults

docks.name: Docks
docks.description: The Docks allow small trading ships to moor in coastal villages, making them more profitable. As a result, the food supply for the town is also increased

drumTowers.name: Drum Tower
drumTowers.description: The Drum Towers are half-round towers set in the walls, which create additional space for units. Drum towers increase the attrition that the enemy army suffers during sieges

dyesWorkshop.name: Dye Workshop
dyesWorkshop.description: The Dyes Workshop processes minerals and prepares dyes

fishmongery.name: Fish Mongery
fishmongery.description: The Fishmongery increases the food supply in the town

fletcher.name: Fletcher
fletcher.description: The Fletcher crafts bows and arrows. He is necessary in order to train ranged units within the town

gateTowers.name: Gate Tower
gateTowers.description: The Gate Towers strengthen the town's gates. Gates protected by towers are much harder to breach. They also provide defending archers with an outstanding tactical position for shooting at enemies

granary.name: Granary
granary.description: The Granary increases the town's food storage. Increased food storage allows the town to endure enemy sieges for a much longer period of time

halberdMastersmithy.name: Halberd Master
halberdMastersmithy.description: The Halberd Mastersmithy is required to train units armed with halberds

harbour.name: Harbour
harbour.description: The Harbour allows bigger ships to anchor in the province, which in turn increases the gold income

hempField.name: Hemp Field
hempField.description: The Hemp Field is an area of fields that grow hemp. Hemp is used for making linen

hostel.name: Hostel
hostel.description: The Hostel provides more space for travelers and workers. It also increases the number of workers in the province. The citizens gather here to entertain themselves, which increases the town's overall happiness

huntersHuts.name: Hunters Hut
huntersHuts.description: The Hunter's Huts are where the hunters skin and prepare their hunted animals

inkMaker.name: Ink Maker
inkMaker.description: The Ink Maker is where ink is produced

inn.name: Inn
inn.description: The Inn provides basic space for travelers and workers. It also increases the number of serfs in the province. The citizens spend time here drinking ale and singing, increasing the town's overall happiness

library.name: Library
library.description: The Library is where enlightened scribes work to increase the number of books written in the kingdom

market.name: Market
market.description: The Market provides space for traders to exchange their goods, increasing the town's gold income

merchantGuild.name: Merchant Guild
merchantGuild.description: The Merchant Guild provides the wealthiest merchants in town with a place to create rules in order to enhance their profits. It increases the town's gold income

moat.name: Moat
moat.description: The Moat is a trench full of water encircling the citadel and can only be crossed via a drawbridge. Moats are the most sophisticated form of fortification and make the town almost invincible against enemy assault

palisade.name: Palisade
palisade.description: The Palisade is the most basic shelter for citizens during times of enemy invasion. Without it, towns are instantly invaded, which usually results in many casualties

parchmentMaker.name: Parchment Maker
parchmentMaker.description: The Parchment Maker is where parchment is made from sheep skin

pickler.name: Pickler
pickler.description: The Pickler uses salt to preserve fresh fish, thereby increasing food storage and the food supply for the town

plateArmourer.name: Plate Armor
plateArmourer.description: The Plate Armourer crafts the most sophisticated pieces of medieval harness. He is required to train high-class units within the town

quarry.name: Quarry
quarry.description: The Quarry is a particular type of opencast mine from which marble is extracted

riggersStore.name: Rigger
riggersStore.description: The Rigger's Store is where riggers produce and sell tackling

saltMine.name: Salt Mine
saltMine.description: The Salt Mine extracts salt from brine. Salt was very important in medieval daily life for preserving and flavoring food

scaleArmourer.name: Scale Armor
scaleArmourer.description: The Scale Armourer is needed to train scale mail-wearing units within the town

scribesOffice.name: Scribes Office
scribesOffice.description: The Scribe's Office gathers the most talented and ambitious members of the clergy

sculptorsGuild.name: Sculpture Guild
sculptorsGuild.description: The Sculptors Guild is where sculptors can gather together to sculpt and sell statues

sheepFarm.name: Sheep Farm
sheepFarm.description: The Sculptor's Guild is where sculptors can gather together to sculpt and sell statues

siegeWorkshop.name: Siege Workshop
siegeWorkshop.description: The Siege Workshop is required to build siege equipment within the town

silverMine.name: Silver Mine
silverMine.description: The Silver Mine extracts pure silver from silver ore. Silver is a rare commodity and strengthens the town's economy, increasing its gold income

spearMaker.name: Spear Maker
spearMaker.description: The Spear Maker is required to train units armed with spears

spinningMill.name: Spinning Mill
spinningMill.description: The Spinning Mill is a place with spinning wheels, which process sheep wool into yarn

stable.name: Stable
stable.description: The Stable is required to train mounted units within the town

stonemason.name: Stone Mason
stonemason.description: The Stone Wall causes enemies to suffer attrition during sieges

stoneWall.name: Stone Wall
stoneWall.description: The Stonemason is where masons craft stone columns

stud.name: Stud Farm
stud.description: The Stud is an area of fields used for breeding horses

swordMastersmithy.name: Sword Master
swordMastersmithy.description: In Sword Mastersmithy, highly skilled smiths forge advanced swords, which are required to train high-class units within the town

swordsmith.name: Sword Smith
swordsmith.description: The Swordsmith is required to train units armed with a sword within the town

tailor.name: Tailor
tailor.description: The Tailor sews clothing for the citizens

tannery.name: Tannery
tannery.description: The Tannery is where the tanner makes leather from cattle hides

taxCollectorsOffice.name: Tax Collector
taxCollectorsOffice.description: The Tax Collector's Office is the office of the King's tax collectors. It increases the town's gold income

toolSmithy.name: Tool Smith
toolSmithy.description: The Tool Smithy supplies the town with quality tools. It increases the number of serfs available in the province

townWatchHouse.name: Town Watch
townWatchHouse.description: The Town Watch House hosts the Town Guards. The larger the town, the greater the number of guards hosted here. Town Guards are very strong and are very helpful during enemy assaults

trainingGrounds.name: Training Grounds
trainingGrounds.description: The Training Grounds are required to train any military units other than Peasants

university.name: University
university.description: The University allows talented and ambitious authors to write many books

vineyard.name: Vineyard
vineyard.description: The Vineyard is an area with yards to grow vines for grapes

waxMaker.name: Wax Maker
waxMaker.description: The Wax Maker is the building where beeswax is processed into much more usable forms

weavingMill.name: Weaver
weavingMill.description: The Weaving Mill is a building where the weavers create linen from hemp

winery.name: Winer
winery.description: The Winery is where grapes are pressed and the juices are made into wine
